content.description: Begin on High Flying Bird and pull over the first bulge. From here work up and right, skipping the open book feature of H.F.B. and a word towards a bolt in a "honey comb" featured spot. Clip this bolt and pull the last strenuous bulge to reach the anchor.
content.protection: Mixed gear with 3 bolts to an anchor
content.location: Start on High Flying Bird and after pulling the first budge, climb up and right.

climbs.name: Unfinished Symphony
climbs.fa: (5.8/A.4)Steve Nelson/Adam Ggrowsky/Mike Azrin mid 70s.1st Free Lead Sean Sucras,Clay Erickson(installed bolt on 2nd pitch) 1984

content.description: Pitch 1-5.8 Starts about 30 feet left of the big off width. Start in the left facing dihedral with a thin crack. Follow crack system up and to the right. Go around corner and rig a hanging belay here. Pitch 2-5.10a ascend the ramp dihedral to a safety bolt and top out above.
content.protection: Mixed gear of varied sizes. Cams for first pitch. Not a bad idea to have a couple tri cams forr belay. Sling the horn and 1 quick draw for pitch 2.
content.location: Follow cliff line left ward till you see the off-width. Past here about 30 feet. Easy walk off or rap from chains on the sport route to you right.

content.description: Its the sport route that climbs a thin seam
content.location: Begins 5 feet left of Fear of Flying

content.description: A nice first trad climb. good stances for placing gear and good gear.
content.protection: small to medium cams and nuts. a good horn to sling around 2/3 the way up the route. there is an anchor the the left on the ledge at the top but NOT one directly above the climb.
content.location: obvious crack that runs up the middle of the face at the end of the trail. it's to the right of the Africa.

content.description: Thin and strenuous, bouldery start. Fun
content.location: Moving left, it's the 1st sport route.  Look for the high 1st clip.  Stay right of the 2nd and 3rd clips.

content.description: Climb the face, clipping the two bolts as you move working into the crack. Work you way through the crack as it widens and becomes slightly overhung. Climb over the ledge and reach the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Two bolts and mid sized cams to the anchor.
content.location: This mixed route is the first one you come to as you approach from the church. Locate the route that has one climb the face and transition into a narrow, then widening crack.

content.description: big long offwidth crack, that gets bulgy and dirty near the top. some real nice sit down rests near the top. finishes out with some face climbing. took me a while to figure out offwidth moves, but it was fun figuring it out. might want to wear pants and tape ankles or wear high top shoes (i've lost some skin to this one). i've only top roped this route using several trees at the top for anchors.
content.protection: I top roped it using long pieces of webbing to anchor to the trees at the top. to lead a person would need several large cams for the offwidth.
content.location: on the left wall of the dihedral, to the left of "Cave City"

climbs.name: Dizzy
climbs.fa: Jim Thurmond, Alan Carrier, Eric Ulner 1987

content.description:
Pitch 1: Start on Unfinished Symphony but climb up and leftward towards the path of fixed gear. After the first clip climb up and leftward to anchor chains. 

  Pitch 2: Climb above the belay and continue through the gully to a safety bolt. Continue by angling up and right, then go around the exposede arete and up to the anchor. (most common route for pitch 2) 

  Pitch 2 Variation: "5.12a" From the belay, traverse rightward to the first bolt. From there crank through the roof and follow the arete to the anchor.
content.protection: natural small to medium gear with bolts.

content.description: A few starting moves will get you to a large ledge, where you can place gear in the crack. Edges and jugs through bolts. Clipping stances are usually pretty good. Finish straight to the final horns; the chains are on the wall above the finish.
content.location: Right of Africa, left of the large chimney/crack, start up on moderate edges and flakes.

content.description: Deep dihedral crack. fairly straightforward climbing. a fall while leading could be bad. several spots you'll have to squeeze through.
content.protection: i used the trees at the top of the cliff for a top rope anchor. you need two long (60') pieces of webbing. to lead you would need a varied rack.
content.location: the dihedral crack to the right of Fear of Flying.

content.protection: bolt anchors at the top for toprope. could be lead but the trad lead rating i think is an R or X.
content.location: a little to the left on the wall that is directly in front of the trail. Identified by the big plate that looks somewhat like Africa or South America (i could see both).

climbs.name: 2 Six-Packs, 1/5 of Scotch & A Full Moon

content.description: Begin with some high bouldering up a 5.5ish looking slab. Reach a 6ish foot protruding boulder with a flat top. Climb on top of that, Climb through 4 bolts to reach the top.
content.location: Sport route to the right of Cave City

content.description: The is the first wall you come to upon completion of the approach
